intro: Homalium gilletii, commonly known as the Guatemalan beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its attractive, clusters of small, violet-blue berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in dense clusters. The fruit is an important food source for various bird species and is also used in traditional medicine.
